definition: not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Estrangement between father and daughter never had, and we can talk about anything.
sentences.chinese: 父女之間從未有過隔閡，我們無話不談。

sentences.english: That means you really put me as a friend, talk about all kinds of things.
sentences.chinese: 這樣說明你們是真的把我當成了朋友，無話不談。

sentences.english: The two sisters although different personality, but share thoughts, no words don't talk.
sentences.chinese: 兩姐妹雖然個性迥異，但卻分享心事，無話不談。
不熟的人也漸漸無話不談。

sentences.english: They began to talk of different things.
But Beijing had plenty to say about Japan detaining the Chinese fishing captain.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國對日本逮捕中國船長事件卻無話不談。

sentences.english: She was always open with her parents.
sentences.chinese: 她總是與父母無話不談。

sentences.english: No words don't talk about people begin to relatively silent.
sentences.chinese: 無話不談的人開始相對無言。

sentences.english: No words don't talk about chums, beautiful girlfriend, suitable work?
sentences.chinese: 無話不談的死黨，漂亮的女朋友，合適的工作？

sentences.english: One is happy it he can encounter his heat to.
sentences.chinese: 一生中能遇著一個可以無話不談的朋友是幸福的。

sentences.english: One is happy if he can encounter someone he can expose his heart to.
sentences.chinese: 一生中能遇着一個可以無話不談的朋友是幸福的。
